title.narrative: Digitising the Dairy Value Chain to create a Pathway for Non-collateralised Credit Extension to Farmers (Emata)

description.narrative: Dairy Farmers, Dairy Cooperatives and providers of Dairy inputs (Merchants) in Uganda

The objective of the project is to promote financial inclusion in the dairy sector value chain by ensuring that dairy farmers obtain access to affordable loans that allow them to invest in the productivity of their farms. This will be achieved through the use of a mobile application that improves dairy farmers' ability to access credit. The process uses the existing cooperative system to provide loans to dairy farmers. With improved access to credit, farmers will then be able to invest in increasing productivity at the farm level, leading to increased incomes and jobs. This intervention targets to ensure that at least 12% of its beneficiaries are women.

This intervention focuses on digitising the dairy value chain in Uganda, with a new application called "Emata". This application will allow dairy cooperatives to digitally record milk deliveries from their members and provide proof of receipt to each farmer showing how much they will earn once their milk is sold. Using the receipts of future earnings, the farmers are able to access credit that they can use at merchants' outlets to purchase essential inputs such as pesticides, feeds and medicines to increase their productivity.

sector.narrative: The biggest component of this project (80%) focuses on promoting financial inclusion for the various players along the dairy value chain, that include the dairy farmers, merchants and cooperatives.

Through improved access to credit, dairy farmers are able to access farm inputs and consequently increase production and productivity at the farm level, thereby positively impacting the overall agricultural sector in the country.
